posts.message:
بقيت أشوف أكواد سي شارب مكتوبة بمساعدة ال lambdas و extension methods و generics بتقوم بالوظيفة على أتم وجه وسهلة القراءة لكنها "هاك" للسي شارب, ليه مصممين يبنوا Functional language فوق Type-safe Object Oriented ؟ حاليا بشوف methods بتاخد parameters مش عارف أقراها أصلا, حاجه زي كدا:
void MyMethod(Foo<Something<Anything>,Func<Action<int>,TValue>> x) !
استخدام الـ methods بيكون شكله رائع ومقروء بالـ lambdas والخ لكن ده مش عك؟ كدا مش بيبوظوا السي شارب؟!

Today Reading: 

Software developers don’t really like to make schedules. Usually, they try to get away without one. “It’ll be done when it’s done!” they say, expecting that such a brave, funny zinger will reduce their boss to a fit of giggles, and in the ensuing joviality, the schedule will be forgotten.

Most of the schedules you do see are halfhearted attempts. They’re stored on a file share somewhere and completely forgotten. When these teams ship, two years late, that weird guy with the file cabinet in his office brings the old printout to the post mortem, and everyone has a good laugh. “Hey look! We allowed two weeks for rewriting from scratch in Ruby!”
posts.caption: joelonsoftware.com
posts.description: Four ways to make realistic schedules a reality. For real.

posts.message:
Using chrome's own states method (About Memory tab) and with the same number/kind of tabs opened, chrome is eating 1.13 GB of RAM, and Firefox takes only 216 MB.
I know, I've many extensions on chrome, but the sum of them all is around 320 MBs.
